newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIAN AIRLINES SELLS SIX JAK 42S.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIAN AIRLINES SELLS SIX JAK 42S.

text.p: Lithuania's transport ministry said on Thursday that Lithuanian Airlines had signed an agreement with Russia's Jakovlev firm last week to sell six of its 11 Soviet-built Jak-42 aircrafts.
"Lithuanian Airlines signed a contract last week with Russia's Jakovlev firm to sell six older Jak-42 aircrafts," Transport Minister Algis Zhvaliauskas told a news conference.
"The contract is worth 28.8 million litas," Zhvaliauskas added.
He also said that the five newer Jak-42 aircrafts might be sold after Lithuanian Airlines lease another Boeing 737 this autumn.
Lithuanian airlines fly three Boeing 737 -200s, two of them owned by the firm.
"We have potential clients to buy the other planes, from Pakistan, Venezuela and Russia," Zhvaliauskas added.
The company said earlier it was in talks with Pakistan's Bhoja Airline Pvt to acquire the planes.
